page.title: 06Gnosall Parish Church
page.content: The Parish Church of St. Lawrence The church is not mentioned in the Domesday Book. It has a wooden and iron door and lovely windows and a clock. It is a Norman church. It was built about 1150. The church is made of a lot of different stones. We made rubbings of the stones. The original Norman church was probably built without aisles. There would have been a low central tower. A lot of the tower still remains. We went to the church to make rubbings of the graves. The oldest one I saw was for the year 1556. The man was around 80 years of age. The graves were sometimes almost underground. On the church wall there is a marking and it meant the level above sea-level. The clock has Roman numerals on it. They look nice because they were painted in real gold.
